meanings.definition: A person who is often in a bad mood or easily annoyed.
meanings.sent1: The grump in our office always frowns and never smiles.
meanings.sent2: My grandpa can be a grump when he doesn't get his afternoon nap.
meanings.sent3: The grump at the grocery store complained about the long checkout line.
meanings.sent4: Even the sunshine couldn't chase away the dark cloud of the grump's mood.
meanings.sent5: The grump's constant scowl made everyone tread lightly around him.

meanings.definition: To complain or grumble in a bad-tempered way.
meanings.sent1: Please don't grump about having to do your chores.
meanings.sent2: She tends to grump whenever things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to grump at the rain outside the window.
meanings.sent4: I could hear him grump about the traffic from the other room.
meanings.sent5: The old man would grump about the weather every single day.
